text: HelpDeskBot seems obnoxious.  I can see how it might be perceived negatively by newcomers.  I'm an old timer and perceive it negatively.

elements.text: HelpDeskBot seems obnoxious.  I can see how it might be perceived negatively by newcomers.  I'm an old timer and perceive it negatively.

text: Maybe the bot could chime in after some time of no responses instead of immediately?

elements.text: Maybe the bot could chime in after some time of no responses instead of immediately?

text:
It is interposing its autoself selfishly, to the point of autorudeness.
To be the first response to every new thread is too heavy a hand.
The slack and discourse threads need to be kept in sync manually
or the reader must ping-pong to see all the responses, and those
on slack go away -- often leaving a partial response on discourse.

MOST CRITICALLY: this makes our slack less welcoming and that
_goes against the so very many individual efforts shaping the Julia Community_

text: I think it is intended to be obnoxious, it was an to get people to stop using helpdesk.

elements.text: I think it is intended to be obnoxious, it was an to get people to stop using helpdesk.

text: Well, that sounds super friendly (and misguided) if that is the case :sweat_smile:

elements.text: Well, that sounds super friendly (and misguided) if that is the case

text: Well it started with the maintainers wanting to close helpdesk because it really isn't very smart that beginner questions get lost, but there was an uproar because people enjoyed the low commitment of posting here. the actual discussion was here on slack so lost to the sands of  time.
